head.supplied: Melbourne botan Garden, ¶ 27/8/68. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to enquire, whether you desire to give me any instructions regarding any final or decisive action, which I should take as a Gov. member o...

div.p: R68/11835, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS file annotation: 'noted by the Honble The President'. Melbourne botan Garden,

I have the honor to enquire, whether you desire to give me any instructions regarding any final or decisive action, which I should take as a Gov. member of the Board of Agriculture in reference to the object to remodel the Board, in as much as I am eager to guard against the possibility that I may enunciate views, which may not be in consonance with the decisions of the Government. Should you not desire to convey to me any instructions, I will be careful in stating to the Board during the pending deliberations, that whatever measures I may urge, are brought forward on my individual views only, and I shall neither fail to watch the interests of the Government in the proceedings.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: The honorable the President of the Board of Land & Works.
